Articles.Content: Okay, I'll use two 'Temeraire' Class ships, two 'Royal Sovereign' Class ships and one 'Victory' Class ship.

Okay, I'll use two 'Temeraire' Class ships, two 'Royal Sovereign' Class ships and one 'Victory' Class ship.

Right then. Though you didn't answer me whether I have to fly my ships all the way to Laythe or not. I'm new, sorry.
No, you can hyperedit them there but once the battle starts it's all manual.

No, you can hyperedit them there but once the battle starts it's all manual.

Ah, OK. Thanks.
I'm done setting up, here's a the persist.

I'm done setting up, here's a the persist.

Shall I start the engagement?

Partial Battle Update

Due to my knowledge of Zeke never backing down from a challenge, I dared him to take out the PGS Take my Hand which he promptly did. However in doing so, he insured that my Flagship, PGS Victory over Death, (an Archangel Class Battle Cruiser) would get a chance to fight, meaning I have 4 anti-ship missiles left instead of one.

Here she is preparing to burn from the shadows or very low Eeloo orbit.

I have to start getting ready for class, I ll finish my move soon
@AlexanderTeaH Sure, I'd like to see how their armour fares.

@ AlexanderTeaH

Is your avatar pic anÃ¢â‚¬Â¦an impaled Kerbal?

@ AlexanderTeaH

Is your avatar pic anÃ¢â‚¬Â¦an impaled Kerbal?

Yeah. He now serves as an example for others.

BATTLE UPDATE

My fighter didn't do crap, even to your TCMS Courage.

PERSISTENCE
The fact that the orbits are exactly the same distance apart makes me oddly satisfied.

BATTLE UPDATE

The TCMS Courage was undamaged by the attack and simply needed to be turned the right way up.

The TCMS Quiberon fires up her engines and lowers her orbit. In a few minutes, she had rendezvoused with the nearest frigate.

I managed to get her into a nice position just behind the Frigate, her first shot was just to fire two I-beams at the ship's stern.

The missiles just bounced off of the ship's sides and flew into the emptiness of space. Realizing that she probably couldn't do much damage with her I-Beams, the Quiberon fires one of her 'Impaler' missiles. This one devastates the ship.

The aftermath:

Persist

BATTLE UPDATE

The TCMS Courage was undamaged by the attack and simply needed to be turned the right way up.

The TCMS Quiberon fires up her engines and lowers her orbit. In a few minutes, she had rendezvoused with the nearest frigate.

http://i.imgur.com/wwhI7mv.png

I managed to get her into a nice position just behind the Frigate, her first shot was just to fire two I-beams at the ship's stern.

http://i.imgur.com/ocVJsAd.png

The missiles just bounced off of the ship's sides and flew into the emptiness of space. Realizing that she probably couldn't do much damage with her I-Beams, the Quiberon fires one of her 'Impaler' missiles. This one devastates the ship.

http://i.imgur.com/HANdBgV.png

The aftermath:

http://i.imgur.com/ymK64Kd.png

Persist

Wait, don't ships attack in order of tonnage?
Oh, bugger. I forgot that one. Give me a minute...

Oh, bugger. I forgot that one. Give me a minute...

Derpity Derp

@Frozen_Heart: Right, the fleet is almost operational. I think that the battle is going to be above Dres. Tonnage requirements coming soon.

Ship names and designations: (You'll recognize a few )

KRC-01 Caspin -- Krykan class

KRC-01 Johnson -- Krykan class

LYC-A1 Kiternyae -- Lykotaek class -- Refit

KYC-34 Spirion -- Kyrian class

AUS-0 Pride of Kalzore -- Capital ship

Edited October 24, 2014 by Starwhip

BATTLE UPDATE

The TCMS Royal Sovereign brings her orbit up and rendezvouses with one of the frigates. She ends up pointing at the armoured side of the ship.

She fires her first SRB missile which does moderate damage.

To make sure this is disabled, she fires four I-beams into her adversary. The first two miss, the other two hit but do little damage.

Angered at the lack of damage caused by the attack, I warped to day, came back to within 200m of the frigate and fired the rest of my missiles. The last I-beams hit but done little damage. The last SRB, however, ripped the ship in two. This gave the captain a feeling of satisfaction that his ship had finally disabled the enemy.

Persist

Edited October 24, 2014 by Megalodon 720
Forgot a picture of the aftermath.

@Frozen_Heart: Right, the fleet is almost operational. I think that the battle is going to be above Dres. Tonnage requirements coming soon.

Got it. Make sure the capital ships aren't too close to each other as I don't fancy a lag fest.
I miss Kerbpaint soooo much

BATTLE UPDATE

The TCMS Royal Sovereign brings her orbit up and rendezvouses with one of the frigates. She ends up pointing at the armoured side of the ship.

http://i.imgur.com/oBXmWvb.png

She fires her first SRB missile which does moderate damage.

http://i.imgur.com/peifrfR.png

To make sure this is disabled, she fires four I-beams into her adversary. The first two miss, the other two hit but do little damage.

http://i.imgur.com/8jEtRq1.png

Angered at the lack of damage caused by the attack, I warped to day, came back to within 200m of the frigate and fired the rest of my missiles. The last I-beams hit but done little damage. The last SRB, however, ripped the ship in two. This gave the captain a feeling of satisfaction that his ship had finally disabled the enemy.

http://i.imgur.com/QVpq1r4.png

Persist

I wonder if I could still fire the SRB's on that thing... I still have to use 2 more of my fighters, though.
If they're still attached to ship's root part then yes, but otherwise it's against the rules.

If they're still attached to ship's root part then yes, but otherwise it's against the rules.

Alright, expect some return fire in the morning.
Alright mate, see you in the morning.
